text: Gavin Williamson is spending more on eat out to help out than our children catch up on their education over the summer holidays after the worst global pandemic in a century. Gavin Williamson really has to wonder where his priorities are.
we need to see real action. we do not need just more slogans from this government.

for some of those people whose Universal Credit was coming to an end it will be heat or eat. it struck Nick Ferrari for Boris Johnson to deliver a speech in that fashion on the very day that Universal Credit was coming to an end for a lot of people.
for some of those people whose Universal Credit was coming to an end it will be heat or eat. Boris Johnson's time to hold the speech was very poor timing.
you put Cristiano Ronaldo out front. you don't put Cristiano Ronaldo in the back four.
Boris Johnson did what Boris Johnson does. Boris Johnson's speech was the speech we got.
the pig industry is livelihoods and the pig industy is people's businesses. the issue of culling healthy pigs that won't go into our food chain has to be resolved.
you know what will happen when we don't want a pig industry in this country. we will import pigmeat that's produced to lower standards.
we have got temporary workers who are here in the UK and they're on temporary visas. the temporary workers could switch to being able to work in the abattoirs.
the temporary workers have to go home in order to reapply for a visa, in order to come back. the Government could take some steps right now that would ease the food production problem.
improving conditions in the industry is about the conditions that people have to work in as well. it is not all about wages.
five years ago, this country took a decision that we were leaving the European Union. that means we've had 5 years under this government to plan.
five years ago, this country took a decision that we were leaving the European Union. there should have been a taskforce to look at where the labour shortages would be.

five years ago, this country took a decision that we were leaving the European Union. we should not be in a position where farmers are facing the prospect of having to slaughter perfectly well animals at a cost to the food supply chain simply because this government hasn't got a plan.
making beds in hotels and picking strawberries and broccoli are skilled jobs. you do not get more skilled than picking a strawberry.
you go to Wheelmore. you will see on fresh fruit and veg.
higher skills and higher wages. putting new capital to work for more machinery that can do everything is happening across all sectors of the economy.
you cannot go straight to, you know, the cheap labour that we gorged on because of uncontrolled migration. you have got to work with industry to take us on that journey.
Nadhim Zahawi is paying seasonal workers £15 an hour at the moment. seasonal workers from abroad wasn't cheap labour.
Wheelmore had a big shout-out on Question Time. well done Wheelmore.
Wheelmore had a big shout-out on Question Time. this has been Wheelmore's night.

that putting new capital to work for more machinery that can do everything is happening across all sectors of the economy is a good thing. you have got to work with industry to take us on that journey.
the fundamental opinions of men in the UK stem from education. you need to modernise the English literature curriculum and have books that encourage discussion about rape or sexual assault.

we are looking at the society of Victoria, which is important. we need to solve the fundamental sickness in society that men have. you need to modernise the English literature curriculum and have books that encourage discussion about rape or sexual assault.
we have food poverty in this country. we are throwing away decent food that could feed children who are going hungry. the pointless mass slaughter of pigs is a ridiculous and sad situation.
the pointless mass slaughter of pigs is just ridiculous. they've got to do something.
Nadhim Zahawi represents the rural constituency of Stratford upon Avon. Nadhim Zahawi represents Vale fresco that produces the salad for supermarkets and Wealmoor.
to see what is happening. I went to see Vale Fresco and Wealmoor.
to bring it to life for you. I went to see Vale Fresco and Wealmoor.

Wealmoor are going to invest in more machinery. Wealmoor are going to invest in upskilling our people. Wealmoor staff will be able to work with the new machinery.
we have got to go further. we have to work with the industry on sustainable solutions to this. the temporary visas is not enough.
everyone has lived through the incredibly difficult period. everyone knows that we have been through an incredibly difficult period.
the question about the Prime Minister's speech was from the audience. the question about the Prime Minister's speech wasn't Fiona Bruces question.
these pigs are under contract. these farmers, this doesn't stop, this doesn't end.
the vets in this country are there to save lives. the fact that the pigs will have to be destroyed is a massive issue for the vets in this country.

18 months ago, farmers were the key workers, they are providing 60% of the country's food. here we are, the first country in the world facing a cull of healthy livestock, potentially up to 120,000 pigs. it has been heartbreaking.
we are left reliant on the markets. gas and electricity bills soaring.
big on slogans, little on detail. we need to see real action.

AudienceMember 20211014QT06's fear is that it is the poorest and most vulnerable who will be left behind after all those soundbites. Boris Johnson will pay attention to areas of Lisa Nandy's where people have to get out in order to get on.
we cannot take energy for granted. the Tories got rid of gas storage.

daffodils worth well over £1.3 million. these sectors are worth a lot to our economy.

the Government could take some steps right now that would ease the food production problem. this is the start and it has to be resolved.

society has got to change. the culture of misogyny of men treating women very badly indeed has gone on for far too long.

the police have paid a heavy price here for an inquiry that should have been called to see how the recruitment process failed catastrophically. the police do a fantastic job.
there could have been prejudicial issues there. it may have been tricky to have an inquiry before the trial.
the police have got to get their crime rates up. the police are not bothered about that they can't get an arrest straightaway.
the police can't get an arrest straightaway. it takes time to solve.

you want to make good on those promises. you have to actually have a plan.
you have to actually have a plan. wherever you look at it, this government just seems to lack a plan to make good on their promises.
the Tories keep saying we like to reduce the debt. the Tories keep spouting we're the party of economic competence.
the debt has quadrupled. where we are today, debt has gone up considerably.
Boris Johson is a clown, a joker and he is a showman. it is incompetence and it is irrational and people must see what Boris is doing.
we need real leadership and my personal opinion, AudienceMember 20211014QT08 is seeing what Keir did last week, that's where leadership is. we must trust in new leaders.
you give somebody something and they get used to it and you take it away. that's a big blow, especially when there is going to be inflation that's rampant in this country over the next few months.

that's a big blow, especially when there is going to be inflation that's rampant in this country over the next few months. the Universal Credit uplift and then a downlift is the most idiotic thing AudienceMember 20211014QT09 can imagine.
the money is going to be taken away. whatever the gas prices, and whatever the haulage crisis, that money should not have been given.

that's a big blow, especially when there is going to be inflation that's rampant in this country over the next few months. whatever the gas prices, and whatever the haulage crisis, that money should not have been given.
the debt has quadrupled. the Tories keep spouting we're the party of economic competence is laughable.
giving the money and taking it away creates a bad feeling, not even those who have it taken away, but people who like me, who don't need it, but didn't get it. the money is going to be taken away.
the way we increased the seasonal workers was pragmatic. you have got to be pragmatic about the working situation.
we want to transition the economy to a high wage, high skill economy as Wheelmore are doing. you've got to calibrate which is your point of focus.
one of the big distribution centres in Manchester is going from a warehouse with no automation to a warehouse with automation. they will have higher skills and higher wages.
they're going to work with robots. they will have higher skills and higher wages.
the people deserve higher skills and higher wages. an economy with higher wages is the one we want to see.
we have a Skills Bill and it is about upskilling and reskilling. Nadhim Zahawi focus in his department is that by the end of this Parliament, they have a skills agenda that does deliver.
more of you voted for Brexit than against Brexit. maybe you're having buyer remorse.
there is a big vegetarian impact that's grown so much. it is a lot of people now don't want to cut up meat.
it takes two years to train a butcher. training a butcher can't happen overnight, that's the point.
they didn't want foreign workers coming over here and taking our jobs. a lot of people voted for Brexit.
we've got a lack of foreign workers. we've got these shortages.
now foreign workers not coming over here and taking our jobs is exactly the situation that we've got. Fiona Bruce is assuming AudienceMember 20211014QT27 didn't vote for Brexit.
there is labour shortages. wage increases means nothing.
the cost of living will continue to increase. the majority of people who will get a wage increase won't feel it.
maybe it is the conditions. it is about people not wanting to do the jobs on offer in abattoirs.
a lot of people voted for Brexit. now foreign workers not coming over here and taking our jobs is exactly the situation that we've got. there is an irony when we're discussing Brexit.

the Tories got rid of gas storage. we slashed solar tariffs. the Tories blocked onshore winds. over the years, we've been running down under the Tories our renewable capacity.
the Tories got rid of gas storage. we are left reliant on the markets.
Nadhim Zahawi could not be worse than his predecessor. Lisa Nandy was extremely pleased to see Nadhim Zahawi in the post of Education Secretary.

at the moment given everything that's happened over the last few months and especially what we've learnt about the killing of Sarah Everard in the last few weeks. rape conviction is at their lowest level ever in this country. women in this country want to know that nobody is beyond the law.
rape conviction is at their lowest level ever in this country. it is a question of supporting women who are obviously coming forward with accusations that need to be followed through.

there have been 81 women murdered by a man since Sarah Everard died on 3rd March. it is a question of supporting women who are obviously coming forward with accusations that need to be followed through.
a lot of women who don't see justice done. rape conviction is at their lowest level ever in this country.

Prince Andrew's sexual assault claims tarnishes the respectability of the monarchy in the UK. the UK monarchy is going downhill.
women's safety is in peril. AudienceMember 20211014QT45 no longer feels safe as a woman.

one police officer killing a woman was an incredible misuse of the power which must never be allowed to happen again. Nick Ferrari would argue that police misuing their power is what we need to look for.
the culture of misogyny of men treating women very badly indeed has gone on for far too long. Prince Andrew should go to the States and he should be held accountable.

the inquiry that's been set up by Priti Patel has to have statutory powers. the Government achieves something after the death of Sarah Everard.
evidence cannot be brought forward and witnesses can't be compelled. witnesses can't be compelled to give evidence.

the judge involved in the Daniel Morgan review talked about the difficulty of getting papers because it was not statutory. the inquiry that has been set up by Priti Patel has to be able to compel people to give evidence, otherwise it will get nowhere.

the judge involved in the Daniel Morgan review talked about the difficulty of getting papers because it was not statutory. the Daniel Morgan review found institutional corruption in his murder. evidence cannot be brought forward and witnesses can't be compelled. statutory powers is what has to happen if we are going to get something.

we're going to make this a watershed moment for what happened and what it achieved and Stephen Lawrence, this is the opportunity. statutory powers is what has to happen if we are going to get something.

we saw empty shelves. they couldn't buy what they wanted when they wanted.

optimism could heat our homes. we'd all be in a great place from yesterday.

adhering to the highest possible standard  means making every effort to support the effort to have a fair hearing and a fair trial. Prince Andrew should or should not go to the States and see his accuser in court.

every bit of the system is stacked against those young women, and sometimes young men, who come forward to allege abuse. it takes incredible bravery to allege abuse.

people who allege abuse don't have access to people in power. all of that makes it far, far more important that people who are in positions of power adhere to the highest possible standards in these cases.

people who allege abuse are not believed and so many times there is pressure put on them and their families to just shut up and go away instead of rocking the boat. all of that makes it far, far more important that people who are in positions of power adhere to the highest possible standards in these cases.

there was no plan for Brexit. Boris Johnson lied in his speech about the things that the Government are proposing to do.
the plan was to get out the foreigners. there was no plan for Brexit.
the plan was for David Cameron to win back his backbenchers. there was no plan for Brexit.
we're trying to employ people to come from abroad. restricting seasonal workers to 2 months is hypocritical and lunacy.

people are watching their livelihoods go up in smoke. what we need is the Prime Minister to get a grip on the shortage of workers.

to have to slaughter perfectly well animals in the middle of a pandemic when we have seen food shortages. having to slaughter perfectly well animals in the middle of a pandemic is really is quite an unbelievable place to have got to.
your staff nurse is on £13 an hour. butchers are on £15. the more we talk about low skilled, low paid, that's not the case.

to have to slaughter perfectly well animals in the middle of a pandemic when we have seen food shortages. Lisa Nandy knows how tough it is to have to work in that industry all year round with all of the pressures that are on people.
the abattoirs have had the China market close to them. the Chinese market closing also impacted the industry here in the UK.
to make sure that we have the need for those abattoirs to process as fast as possible. we are doing everything we can to make sure that we get things like the English language requirement resolved.
the global economy has rebounded rapidly post-pandemic. you're seeing global shortages everywhere.
we're doing everything we can, in my view, to work with the farming community. we are doing everything we can to make sure that we get things like the English language requirement resolved.
butchers are on the visa list to be able to come to this country and do that work. we have got to be pragmatic and do what we're doing as we're doing.

domestic abuse and sexual violence is not of the highest priority for police forces. police forces need flexibility in order to decide whether domestic abuse and sexual violence is a priority.

Nadhim Zahawi hopes Lisa Nandy voted for the Domestic Abuse Bill.

you cannot imagine any minister saying that it is not of the highest priority and that police forces need flexibility in order to decide whether it is a priory about terrorism. it cannot be right to say that domestic abuse and sexual violence is not of the highest priority and that police forces need flexibility in order to decide whether it is a priority.
